From Wiktionary, the free dictionary
See also: compoñer

Asturian

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From Latin compōnere.

Verb

[edit]

componer

  1. to compose

Conjugation

[edit]

This verb needs an inflection-table template.

Derived terms

[edit]
  • descomponer

Related terms

[edit]
  • composición
  • compuesta
  • compuestu

Further reading

[edit]
  • “componer”, in Diccionariu de la llingua asturiana [Dictionary of the Asturian Language] (in Asturian), 1ª edición, Academia de la Llingua Asturiana, 2000, →ISBN
  • Xosé Lluis García Arias (2002–2004), “componer”, in Diccionario general de la lengua asturiana [General Dictionary of the Asturian Language] (in Spanish), Editorial Prensa Asturiana, →ISBN

Spanish

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Inherited from Latin compōnere.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /kompoˈneɾ/ [kõm.poˈneɾ]
  • Audio (Spain):(file)
  • Rhymes: -eɾ
  • Syllabification: com‧po‧ner

Verb

[edit]

componer (first-person singular present compongo, first-person singular preterite compuse, past participle compuesto)

  1. to compose (write music)
  2. to compose, make up
  3. to repair, fix
    Synonyms: reparar, arreglar
  4. (reflexive) to consist [with de ‘of something’]
